tr.td: Take 1,000 mg by mouth 2 (two) times a day.

section.title: Active Problems - as of this encounter

tr.td: Comments: The patient smoked when she was a teenager, but has not smoked in over 30 years.

section.title: Last Filed Vital Signs - in this encounter

translation.displayName: Vital signs, weight, height, head circumference, oximetry, BMI, and BSA panel - HL7.CCDAr1.1

item.caption: Thorough, John - 04/12/2016 4:29 PM CDT
item.paragraph: From a renal perspective, over the last 3 years her Cr has progressively increased from 80 to 175 umol/L with a current eGFR of 32 mL/min. Her most recent protein:Cr is elevated at 201 mg/ mmol. She has noted worsening peripheral edema and despite my best efforts, her glycemic control remains suboptimal. Lastly, her renal ultrasound reveals bilateral renal atrophy with the absence of any hydronephrosis.

section.title: Plan of Treatment - as of this encounter

td.paragraph: Results for this procedure are in the results section.
